numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Mali is at the bottom of the chart.
2. This suggests that adults in Mali generally believe that the world is getting worse with each generation.
3. Indonesia is at the top of the chart.
4. More than 75% of adults in Indonesia are positive about changing times.
5. Mali is not a rich country.
6. The economy of Mali is based on farming.
7. Mali is not self-sufficient in food.
8. This may be a reason why people in Mali think that times are getting worse.
9. In 2020, the GDP per capita in Mali was 914 US dollars.
10. The GDP growth rate of Mali was -2.5%.
11. The economy of Mali is in decline.
12. Indonesia is the 4th most populous country in the world.
13. Indonesia is the largest economy in Asia.
14. In 2019, the GDP of Indonesia was about 1.11 trillion US dollars.
15. In 2019, the annual inflation in Indonesia was 2.72%.
16. From January 2020 to June 2020, the economy of Indonesia shrank by 1.26%.
17. The impact of COVID-19 caused this shrinkage.
18. I wonder why we are doing this activity.
19. I wonder why only 21 countries were surveyed.
20. I wonder what this graph will do for the future.
21. This chart changes my previous impression of Indonesia.
22. I usually thought that high happiness exists in developed countries.
23. China is a developed country.
24. The United States is a developed country.
25. The headline is: Does having money really make people feel happier.
